text: Then the Lord called to Moses and spoke to him from the Meeting Tent:
“Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘When someone among you presents an offering to the Lord, you must present your offering from the domesticated animals, either from the herd or from the flock.
“‘If his offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he must present it as a flawless male; he must present it at the entrance of the Meeting Tent for its acceptance before the Lord.

He must <st data-num="05564" class="">lay</st> his <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> of the <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st>, and it will be <st data-num="07521" class="">accepted</st> for him to <st data-num="03722" class="">make atonement</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="05921" class="">behalf</st>.

Then the one presenting the offering must slaughter the bull before the Lord, and the sons of Aaron, the priests, must present the blood and splash the blood against the sides of the altar, which is at the entrance of the Meeting Tent.

Next, the one presenting the offering<n id="1" /> must <st data-num="06584" class="">skin</st> the <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st> and <st data-num="05408" class="">cut</st> it into <st data-num="05409" class="">parts</st>,

and the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st>, the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>,<n id="1" /> must <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st> and <st data-num="06186" class="">arrange</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st>.

Then the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st>, the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>, must <st data-num="06186" class="">arrange</st> the <st data-num="05409" class="">parts</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> and the <st data-num="06309" class="">suet</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> is <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>.<n id="2" />

Finally, the one presenting the offering must wash its entrails and its legs in water, and the priest must offer all of it up in smoke on the altar—it is a burnt offering, a gift of a soothing aroma to the Lord.
“‘If his offering is from the flock for a burnt offering—from the sheep or the goats—he must present a flawless male,
and must slaughter it on the north side of the altar before the Lord, and the sons of Aaron, the priests, will splash its blood against the altar’s sides.

Next, the one presenting the offering<n id="1" /> must <st data-num="05408" class="">cut</st> it into <st data-num="05409" class="">parts</st>, <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> its <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> and its <st data-num="06309" class="">suet</st>, and the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> must <st data-num="06186" class="">arrange</st> them <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> is <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>.

Then the one presenting the offering must wash the entrails and the legs in water, and the priest must present all of it and offer it up in smoke on the altar—it is a burnt offering, a gift of a soothing aroma to the Lord.
“‘If his offering to the Lord is a burnt offering of birds, he must present his offering from the turtledoves or from the young pigeons.

The <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> must <st data-num="07126" class="">present</st> it <st data-num="0413" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>, <st data-num="04454" class="">pinch off</st><n id="1" /> its <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> and <st data-num="06999" class="">offer</st> the head<n id="2" /> <st data-num="06999" class="">up in smoke</st> on the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>, and its <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> must be <st data-num="04680" class="">drained out</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="07023" class="">side</st> of the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>.

Then the priest<n id="1" /> must <st data-num="05493" class="">remove</st> its <st data-num="04760" class="">entrails</st> by cutting off its tail <st data-num="05133" class="">feathers</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="07993" class="">throw</st> them<n id="3" /> to the <st data-num="06924" class="">east</st> <st data-num="0681" class="">side</st> of the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> of <st data-num="01880" class="">fatty ashes</st>,

and tear it open by its wings without dividing it into two parts. Finally, the priest must offer it up in smoke on the altar on the wood which is in the fire—it is a burnt offering, a gift of a soothing aroma to the Lord.
